textRun.content: HTMLDeck is a system for building HTML-based slide decks for Recruit41 sales and business presentations. Each deck is a single self-contained HTML file that renders at 1280x720px and prints to PDF via Chrome headless.

Instead of using PowerPoint or Google Slides, HTMLDeck uses pure HTML + CSS to create pixel-perfect slide decks. This approach gives full control over layout, typography, and rendering, and produces consistent PDF output across environments.
Each deck is a single .html file containing all slides
Slides are exactly 1280 x 720 pixels (16:9 aspect ratio)
CSS handles all styling - no Tailwind, no frameworks
Chrome headless converts HTML to PDF for distribution
ECharts is used for data visualizations (funnel charts, bar charts)
The project is organized around a skill-based system that enables Claude Code to build new decks from reusable components:
- The master reference document containing the full design system, fragment library, and deck-building workflow
- A complete HTML template with the CSS design system but no slide content. Starting point for every new deck
- Reusable brand assets (logos, icons, badges, avatars)
- The original reference deck (10 slides) that established all design patterns
- Deck-specific images (client logos, team photos, screenshots)
- Project instructions for Claude Code, including context about Recruit41
The design system is defined entirely in CSS and lives inside scaffold.html. It establishes consistent visual rules across all decks.
Primary orange - titles, accents, sidebar, borders
Light peach background - agent cards, highlights
Dark blue - icon squares, nav dots, section headers
Every content slide follows a consistent structure:
- Adds left padding for the orange sidebar bar
- 48px orange left bar with rotated text label
- Flex column content area inside the slide

The fragments/ directory contains 11 battle-tested slide layouts. Each fragment is a complete HTML snippet showing exact styling, spacing, and real content from the reference deck. To use a fragment, copy it into your deck and edit the content.
Opening slide with full-bleed orange background, title, tagline, and hero image
Photo grid with name/bio cards, stats row, and logo strip
Left stacked cards with colored borders + right visual area (chart, image)
Feature showcases with icon squares and description rows
Horizontal flow boxes with arrows + pillar cards below
Dense text with Problem/Solution/Outcome pattern + bottom quote
Side-by-side comparison halves with title, description, and logo rows
Badge row + data table. Good for feature matrices and security details
Warning cards + statement + grid for wrap-up slides
Left descriptions + right diagram for system architecture
Three equal icon-topped cards for value propositions
How to Build a New Deck
Building a new deck follows a straightforward copy-compose-render workflow:
Add any deck-specific images (client logos, team photos, screenshots)
Browse the fragments in skill/fragments/ and pick layouts that match your content
Copy chosen fragments into the <body> of your deck file, in order
Edit the content - fragments contain real content from the reference deck showing exact styling and structure
If using ECharts, uncomment the script tags and add chart initialization with
Open the HTML file in Chrome for a browser preview (screen styles add spacing between slides)
Render to PDF using Chrome headless (see the render command below)
Verify the PDF: check colors, content fit, images, page breaks, and font rendering
The deck is rendered to PDF using Chrome's headless mode with specific flags to match the slide dimensions:
- Removes default print margins so slides fill the page
- Removes the date/URL headers Chrome adds by default
To generate PNG previews of the rendered PDF (requires poppler):
How Claude Code Uses This System
This project is designed to be operated by Claude Code (Anthropic's AI coding assistant). The key integration points are:
- Provides Claude Code with context about Recruit41's product, value proposition, target segments, and clients. This ensures content written by Claude is accurate and on-brand

- The complete design system reference that Claude reads before building any deck. It contains color tokens, typography rules, layout components, fragment descriptions, image inventories, and rendering instructions
- Claude copies this as the starting point and adds slide fragments into it
- Claude picks appropriate layouts based on the content requirements and assembles them into a deck

The workflow is conversational: a user describes the deck they need (e.g., "make a 5-slide deck covering our campus hiring solution"), and Claude reads the skill files, selects appropriate fragments, customizes the content, renders to PDF, and iterates based on feedback.
(Google Fonts) - Primary typeface across all slides
- Icons throughout slides (feature lists, diagrams, UI elements)
- Data visualizations like funnel charts and bar charts (only included when needed)
Brand assets (logos, icons, badges) live in skill/images/ and are copied into each deck
Client logos and team photos are deck-specific and stored in the deck's own images/ directory
When extracting images from PDF sources, pdfimages produces separate RGB and alpha mask files that must be composited using Python Pillow
Agent icons are dark/black PNGs made white on orange backgrounds via CSS filter: brightness(10)
-webkit-print-color-adjust: exact is required on body, otherwise Chrome strips background colors
Must set animation: false since Chrome headless captures a single frame
.slide has overflow: hidden, so all content must fit within 1280x720
Both break-after: page and page-break-after: always are set for cross-browser compatibility
